questions.guidance_text: Enter your company's legal name as registered with the government. This ensures the insurance policy is issued to the correct entity and claims can be processed without legal complications.
questions.placeholder: e.g., XYZ Retail Stores Pvt Ltd

questions.guidance_text: Your 15-digit GST number validates your business registration and determines tax calculations on your premium. Ensure this matches your official GST certificate.
Select your business type as it helps assess the foot traffic and risk exposure of your glass installations. Businesses with higher customer footfall typically face more accidental damage risks.
Describe your business type if not listed above. Include details about customer interaction levels and the importance of glass in your operations.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Art Gallery with Glass Displays

questions.guidance_text: Provide your company's registered address for official correspondence. Include building name, street, area, city, state, and pincode for complete identification.
questions.placeholder: e.g., 301, Commerce House, Linking Road, Bandra West, Mumbai, Maharashtra - 400050

questions.guidance_text: Enter the exact address where the glass to be insured is installed. If same as registered address, you can repeat it. This location will be inspected if a claim arises.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Ground Floor Showroom, Phoenix Mall, Senapati Bapat Road, Pune, Maharashtra - 411016

questions.guidance_text: Name of the person responsible for managing this insurance policy. They will be contacted for policy servicing, renewals, and claims processing.
Provide a 10-digit mobile number for quick communication. You'll receive SMS updates about policy status, claim settlements, and renewal reminders on this number.
Your email for receiving policy documents, premium receipts, and claim forms. Ensure this email is regularly monitored to avoid missing important policy communications.

questions.question_text: Type of Glass to be Insured
questions.guidance_text: Select all types of glass you want to insure. Specialty glass like stained or bulletproof glass has higher replacement costs and may affect your premium. Toughened glass typically has lower premiums due to its strength.
Select all locations where insured glass is installed. External glass faces higher risk from weather and vandalism, while high-traffic areas like main doors have more accidental damage risk.
Count all individual glass panels or panes you want to insure. Each separate piece of glass counts as one panel, even if part of a larger window or door system.
Provide approximate dimensions of your glass panels in feet or meters. If you have various sizes, give the most common size or a range. This helps calculate replacement costs.

questions.question_text: Total Area of Glass to be Covered (sq. ft.)
questions.guidance_text: Calculate the total square footage of all glass to be insured by multiplying length x width of all panels. Accurate measurement ensures adequate coverage without over-insuring.
Glass thickness affects both strength and replacement cost. Thicker glass is more expensive to replace but less prone to accidental breakage. Standard commercial glass is typically 8-12mm.
Enter the year when the glass was installed. Older installations may have wear and tear affecting their strength. Recent installations with warranties may qualify for better rates.

questions.question_text: Has the glass been laminated or reinforced?
questions.guidance_text: Laminated or reinforced glass has a protective film or wire mesh that holds fragments together when broken, reducing injury risk and often qualifying for lower premiums.
Enter the total replacement cost of all glass including installation charges, labor, and any special treatments like tinting. This should reflect current market rates, not original purchase price.
Select when you want insurance coverage to begin. Allow 2-3 days from today for policy processing. If replacing an existing policy, align with its expiry to avoid coverage gaps.
Select your desired policy end date. Annual policies are standard, but longer terms may offer premium discounts. Ensure continuous coverage by renewing before expiry.

questions.question_text: Is the building protected by CCTV and/or security personnel?
questions.guidance_text: Security measures reduce vandalism and malicious damage risks, potentially lowering your premium. 24/7 surveillance and guards provide the best protection against intentional glass damage.

questions.question_text: Is the glass vulnerable to accidental external impacts?
questions.guidance_text: Consider if your glass faces busy streets, parking areas, playgrounds, or construction sites where vehicles, balls, or debris might cause accidental damage. Higher exposure means higher risk.
Describe specific risks like heavy foot traffic, nearby sports facilities, vehicular movement, or ongoing construction. This helps insurers understand your unique risk factors.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Glass faces main road with heavy traffic; Adjacent to cricket ground where balls occasionally hit windows

questions.question_text: Has the premises or glass sustained damage in the past 3 years?
questions.guidance_text: Declare any glass damage incidents, whether claimed under insurance or not. Frequent damages indicate higher risk but being transparent helps get accurate quotes.
Provide details of each incident: date, cause of damage, panels affected, and repair cost. Include preventive measures taken to avoid recurrence.
questions.placeholder: e.g., March 2023 - Accidental impact by delivery vehicle, 2 panels damaged, Cost: ₹50,000, Installed bollards for protection

questions.question_text: Is the glass engraved, colored, or containing artwork/advertising?
questions.guidance_text: Decorative or advertising elements on glass increase replacement costs significantly. Custom designs, logos, or artistic work require special consideration in coverage and claims.

Describe the special features, their value, and whether they can be easily replicated. Include details about any copyrighted designs or custom artwork that would need special replacement arrangements.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Company logo etched on main door glass, valued at ₹30,000; Custom stained glass artwork in lobby worth ₹2,00,000

questions.question_text: Coverage for Riots, Strike & Malicious Damage (RSMD) required?
questions.guidance_text: RSMD covers glass damage during civil disturbances, protests, or intentional vandalism. Essential for businesses in commercial areas or those with high public visibility.
Enter the maximum amount you want covered for RSMD damages. This is typically a percentage (50-100%) of your total sum insured, based on your risk assessment.
Covers the cost of temporary wooden boards or protective sheets while waiting for glass replacement. Important for maintaining security and weather protection after damage.

questions.question_text: Coverage for Loss of Advertising/Signage on Glass?
questions.guidance_text: If your glass displays business signage, logos, or advertising, this covers the cost of recreating them on replacement glass. Essential for retail stores with branded storefronts.

questions.question_text: Coverage for Tinting, Frosting, or Special Treatments?
questions.guidance_text: Covers the additional cost of reapplying special treatments like UV tinting, privacy frosting, or anti-glare coatings on replacement glass. Standard policies may not include these costs.
If you have existing plate glass insurance, mention your current insurer. Continuous coverage history often results in better renewal terms and no-claim bonuses.
Your current policy number helps verify coverage history and claim records. This information speeds up the quotation process and ensures continuity benefits.
Knowing your current policy's expiry helps ensure seamless coverage transition. Renewing before expiry maintains continuity benefits and prevents coverage gaps.
Your claims history directly impacts premium rates. No-claim records typically earn discounts, while multiple claims may increase premiums but ensure you still get coverage.
For each claim, provide: date of loss, cause, claim amount, and settlement amount. Being transparent helps insurers assess risk accurately and provide appropriate coverage.
questions.placeholder: e.g., Claim 1: Date: 15/06/2023, Cause: Accidental breakage, Claimed: ₹75,000, Settled: ₹70,000

questions.guidance_text: Upload your current or previous plate glass insurance policy for reference. This helps insurers understand your existing coverage and offer matching or better terms.
Upload building floor plans showing glass locations, or photos of glass installations. Visual documentation helps insurers assess risk accurately and speeds up the underwriting process.
